verbose_text: Then, thrombin triggers platelet activation and consequently factors V and VII.5 Recombinant factor VII activated (rFVIIa) is an agent approved in both hemophilia A and B patients, factor VII deficiency, and Glanzmann 's thrombasthenia.6 It has also been used in several surgical conditions to stop persistent bleeding in patients without inherited coagulopathies.6 We report the case of a man with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) admitted to our general intensive care unit (ICU) for respiratory failure and presenting a late postprocedural bleeding after 36 hours from PDT due to thrombocytopenia.
evidence:
thrombin triggers platelet activation and consequently factors V and VII.5


Recombinant factor VII
